content.description: An object is moving along the <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis. The object’s position as a function of time is given by <math alttext="y equals, alpha times t cubed minus beta t plus phi" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>α</mi> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mi>β</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>ϕ</mi> </mstyle> </math>, where <math alttext="alpha equals 1 meter per second cubed" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="beta equals 4 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="phi equals 5 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ϕ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mstyle></math>.
content.question: What is the acceleration of the object at time <math alttext="t equals 3.0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="6 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="18 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mn>18</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="20 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="23 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mn>23</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="18 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mn>18</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
